intro: Platystemon pilosellus, commonly known as the hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are hairy and often have a silvery or grayish appearance, which helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. Platystemon pilosellus produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
